protocol.name: P-G4638-1
protocol.text: Approximately 100 sterilized seeds were transferred to sterile 125-mL Erlenmeyer flasks containing 20 mL of 1X MS basal salts supplemented with 1X vitamin B5, and 0.1 mM MES-NaOH (pH 5.7) buffer.  Seedlings were grown in controlled environment chambers and the flasks were continuously agitated with a rotary shaker for 7 days.  Seedlings were grown in growth chamber at 22Â°C for 7 days under fluorescent lights providing 150 ± 10 ¼mol /m2/s1 photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) with 16-h days.

protocol.name: P-G4638-2
protocol.text: One-week old seedlings were exposed to Nep1 (10 ug/mL) treatment or using sterilized, deionized H2O as a control.  Seedlings were harvested after 30 min treatment, filtered through Whatman #1 filter paper (Whatman, Middlesex, UK), rinsed thoroughly with deionized water and were immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen.

protocol.name: P-G4638-3
protocol.text: The harvested whole seedlings were ground to a fine powder under liquid nitrogen using a mortar and pestle.  Total RNA was extracted using a RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) as described by the manufacturer and then purified with a RNeasy MinElute Cleanup Kit (Qiagen).

protocol.name: P-G4638-4
protocol.text: Approximately 100 sterilized seeds were transferred to sterile 125-mL Erlenmeyer flasks containing 20 mL of 1X MS basal salts supplemented with 1X vitamin B5, and 0.1 mM MES-NaOH (pH 5.7) buffer.  Seedlings were grown in controlled environment chambers and the flasks were continuously agitated with a rotary shaker for 7 days.  Seedlings were grown in growth chamber at 22Â°C for 7 days under fluorescent lights providing 150 ± 10 ¼mol /m2/s photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) with 16-h days.

protocol.name: P-G4638-5
protocol.text: One-week old seedlings were exposed to Nep1 (10 g mL-1) treatment or using sterilized, deionized H2O as a control.  Seedlings were harvested after 30 min treatment, filtered through Whatman #1 filter paper (Whatman, Middlesex, UK), rinsed thoroughly with deionized water and were immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen.
